paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted variants in the BRCA2 gene along with penetrance data from the study on Hispanic breast cancer.

patients.demographics: Mean age 50.6 years, predominantly Hispanic women

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Two of the seven patients with deleterious mutations had triple-negative disease (29%); this is not significantly different from those patients without identified mutations.
Only two of the patients with identified mutations had a family history of breast cancer, with one second-degree relative in each case.

functional_data.summary: The variant is predicted to result in a premature stop codon, leading to loss of function.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families as indicated by family history.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical correlation and functional studies.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with a significant risk of breast cancer.
key_quotes: Women with deleterious mutations were younger (43 versus 51 years of age, P=0.029).
Two of the seven patients with deleterious mutations had triple-negative disease.

tables_processed.table_caption: Classification of mutations and non-synonymous variants

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
